WorkItem.Description:
Since this issue has not yet been resolved I put it back on again:
When a user wants to RSVP and logs in on Events_View that he returns to the Event he was planning to RSVP.
WorkItem.Summary: Return to page when logging in

Comments.Message: Sorry about that... you have like 4 issues in one Issue. This is a hard one to figure out... the URL is just taken from the Page.URL method, which inherently doesn't use QueryStrings. I can add a method to redirect back to events/list or events/calendar... but I will need to do some searching for the answer as far as the event/view page is concerned.

I understand.I have been trying to figure out how it works in Forums. (A user (not logged in) wants to reflect on a thread, gets redirected to LoginPage and returns to the thread he was at.

Is this what we have to follow?

I have been trying to figure out what happens there, but it is beyond me grasp i'm afraid.
It happens b/c of the query strings. There really isn't a way arround it unless there is some property of Request.Url that outputs query string.
